'''Anorith''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''アノプス''' ''Anopth'') is a dual-type {{2t|Rock|Bug}} [[Fossil]] {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It is resurrected from a [[Root and Claw Fossils|Claw Fossil]] and [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Armaldo}} starting at [[level]] 40.

==Biology==
Anorith is a greenish-gray, arthropod Pokémon, resembling an {{wp|anomalocaris}}. A stalk extends from either side of its head, with large, spherical eyes at the tips. The middle of its head is black with two red, teardrop-shaped markings, and an x-shaped mouth is visible on the underside of its torso. Beneath its head are two large, segmented claws that serve as weapons and are used to capture prey. On each side of its body are four white appendages with red tips. These wing-like projections are used to propel Anorith through the water. 

Now extinct in the wild, it lived in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Water's-edge Pokémon|the seas}} of ancient times. It is still extant under the ownership of {{pkmn|Trainer}}s through revival from [[Root and Claw Fossils|Claw Fossils]]. Despite this, Anorith can no longer thrive in today's oceans because the water composition has changed since ancient times.

==In the anime==
[[File:Wales Island Anorith.png|thumb|220px|left|Anorith in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Anorith debuted in ''[[AG102|Where's Armaldo?]]''. Residing on a small island called [[Wales Island]], located the east of Hoenn's mainland, it was being studied by [[Professor Proctor]] and [[Annie Proctor]] alongside the other Fossil Pokémon from Hoenn. During the episode, it evolved into {{p|Armaldo}}.

===Minor appearances===
An Anorith appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]''.

Multiple Anorith were resurrected and studied by the scientists in [[Oreburgh City]] in ''[[DP017|Wild in the Streets]]''. They were seen along with several other Pokémon within the habitat created for the revived Pokémon.

==In the manga==
[[File:Lileep and Anorith Adventures.png|thumb|150px|Anorith in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Anorith first appeared in ''[[PS180|The Last Battle XIV]]'', as a wild Pokémon pictured in one of the many photographs of unseen Pokémon that {{adv|Professor Oak}} discovered. 

An Anorith was set free alongside an {{p|Lileep}} during {{adv|Ruby}}'s stay in [[Fallarbor Town]] in ''[[PS225|Tanks, but No Tanks, Anorith & Lileep]]'', and using the raw talent in battle that he inherited from [[Norman]], he calmed them (when he saw that nobody was looking, of course).

==Trivia==
* Anorith and its evolution are the only Pokémon with the Ability {{a|Swift Swim}} that are also weak to {{t|Water}}.

===Origin===
Anorith appears to be closely based on an ''{{wp|Anomalocaris}}'' with some characteristics of a {{wp|trilobite}}. It greatly resembles {{wp|brine shrimp}} as well, having similar eyes and feather-like protrusions on its sides.

====Name origin====
Anorith may be a combination of ''Anomalocaris'', ''{{wp|anorthosite}}'', and ''lith'' (rock or stone).

Anopth may be a combination of ''Anomalocaris'' and ''{{wp|arthropod}}''.
